author: thrash56
body: Though I own 100 shares of ARKX, my problem with the ETF is that it is full of other not-really-space-industry stocks, like Trimble, Unity, and the 3D Printing ETF (which itself is another of Cathie's ETFs). I want direct space exposure. And with how cheap RKLB, ATSR, ASTS, and others are, I feel it better to buy the individual names direct.

author: epyonxero
body: CAT, TRMB, TSM All getting close to my price alerts

author: SECmydick
body:
15 stocks, spread throughout Roth IRA and taxable account, equal weights. Age 25. Very high risk tolerance (as you can likely tell...) I tried to diversify into multiple sectors while still remaining aggressive-growth focused. (Yes, I know, lots of ARK stocks, Cathie sucks, etc. I'm focusing on a 5-10 year time horizon so I don't mind the volatility.)

Anything you would suggest adding/selling?

REAL - The RealReal

U - Unity

SHLS - Shoals (solar)

TDOC - Teladoc

BE - Bloom Energy (hydrogen)

CHWY - Chewy

BLI - Berkeley Lights (biotech)

SQSP - Squarespace

TRMB - Trimble

CRSR - Corsair

APPH - AppHarvest (vertical farming)

VUZI - Vuzix

FTCH - Farfetch

OUST - Ouster (LiDAR)

author: wolley_dratsum
body:
A lot of not so great companies, such as Iridium, Elbit Systems, Joby Aviation, Trimble. 

Others that did well during the pandemic (like Zoom and Robinhood) but have fallen recently.

Just not a good mix of stocks IMO. Rather weird assortment if you ask me.

author: MMXIX_
body: This has been said for the last 5 years. The problem is WU already uses "krypto" to transfer money and the are the most prepared for the massive regulatory requirements that will be coming down on "krypto" trades on the future because they already do I think for cash transactions. Your "DD" is worthless and you are going to lose people's money.

author: ZDubzNC
body: KEEP THIS MAN AWAY FROM THE WU-TANG CLAN!!!

author: 12to12
body:
I have been considering buying puts on WU as well. I have been struggling with the timeline though, thinking that this will be an extremely slow unwind of a company that will stay entrenched in its current business plan until there is some rapid sentiment shift.
One more thing to consider…Blockbuster almost bought Netflix, when Netflix was still sending out dvds in the mail, they would of looked like geniuses predicting better broadband and future streaming demand. There is nothing to stop WU from acquiring a blockchain company like Ripple or building their own blockchain and crypto wallet…but will they do it…or cling to the past and die off like Sears and others?

author: Mammoth-Chip
body: Well until you actually show how much you shorted I’m not inclined to believe your resolve that WU will fail. Post short position or no balls

author: Tap-Apart
body:
You can't regulate krypto. (And I had to call it that in the post because it would be auto-removed). 

Also, WU business still has fees. 

People will choose a system with lower fees. 

Yes there is a way to use Krypto in a nearly fee-less manner, but I'm guessing you believe Elizabeth Warren lol

You can look at the on chain data and see addresses growing. Look it up yourself! 

Remittance is the number one reason for this. 

You have no idea what is coming.

author: supsupman1001
body: sofi's galileo engine on 3rd party apps like wise.com will replace moneygram and western union and reduce swift transfers from traditional banks.

author: trading123456
body: The problem is you just expect western union to roll over and die, just like many people expected GameStop to do. If you don’t think they’ll get themselves in the orange coin game or at least fight to keep their company afloat and be competitive then you’re in trouble.

author: Tap-Apart
body:
Western union can't buy remittance. 

It's not on their balance sheet. 

They can see this coming and do nothing.

Edit: pick up a drinking habit because this shit is about to go wild.
